summary.en: Raelianism (Raëlism) is a modern new religious movement that teaches humans were created by extraterrestrials.
summary.zh: 拉埃尔教（Raëlism）是一种现代新兴宗教运动，主张人类由外星文明创造。

definition.en: A new religious movement (also called Raëlism) founded in France in the 1970s, teaching that humans were created by advanced extraterrestrials called the Elohim.
definition.zh: 一种新兴宗教运动（也称 Raëlism / 拉埃尔教），起源于20世纪70年代的法国，主张人类是由名为 Elohim 的高等外星文明创造的。

examples.en: Raelianism is sometimes discussed in books about modern new religious movements.
examples.zh: 拉埃尔教有时会出现在讨论现代新兴宗教运动的书中。

examples.en: She wrote a report comparing Raelianism with other UFO religions.
examples.zh: 她写了一篇报告，把拉埃尔教和其他UFO宗教作比较。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“rellyanism”不是常见标准拼写；最接近、最常被检索到的词是“Raelianism / Raëlism”（拉埃尔教）。如果你想查的是别的词（例如“relativism 相对主义”或“religionism 宗教至上/宗教化倾向”等），可以告诉我上下文句子，我会帮你定位正确拼写与含义。
“Raelianism”来自创始人自称“Raël”的名字，英语里也常写作“Raëlism”。在新闻与学术语境中通常作为专有名词使用，注意首字母大写。

summary.en: “Rellyanite” isn’t a recognized English word; you probably meant “reliant” (= dependent on).
summary.zh: “rellyanite”不是标准英语词；你可能想写“reliant”（= 依赖……的）。

definition.en: Not a standard English word; it is likely a misspelling or a name.
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词；很可能是拼写错误或专有名词（名字/用户名等）。

examples.en: “Rellyanite” doesn’t appear in standard dictionaries—did you mean “reliant”?
examples.zh: “rellyanite”在常见词典里查不到——你是不是想写“reliant”？

definition.en: (Likely intended) depending on someone or something for help or support.
definition.zh: （可能你想表达的词）依赖……的；依靠……支持的。

examples.en: Children are often reliant on their parents.
examples.zh: 孩子通常依赖父母。

examples.en: Our small business is reliant on tourism.
examples.zh: 我们的小企业依赖旅游业。

extraExplanation: 从拼写看，最接近的常用词是 **reliant**（依赖的）。如果你想表达“可信赖/可靠”，更常用的是 **reliable**。如果你告诉我你看到这个词的句子或来源（游戏名、小说、人名等），我也可以帮你更准确判断。

summary.en: Reload means to load again—either refilling something (like a gun or device) or refreshing a webpage/app to get the newest content.
summary.zh: reload 指“再次装载/补充”，也常指“刷新网页或应用以获取最新内容”。

definition.en: To load something again; to put new bullets into a gun, refresh supplies, or refill/repower a device.
definition.zh: 重新装载；再次装填（子弹/弹药）；补充（物资）；给设备重新装入/补充（电源、材料等）。

examples.en: The guard reloaded his weapon after the first round.
examples.zh: 第一轮结束后，警卫给武器重新装填了子弹。

examples.en: I need to reload my camera with fresh batteries.
examples.zh: 我需要给相机换上新电池。

definition.en: To refresh a page, app, or data so the newest version appears.
definition.zh: （网页/应用/数据）重新加载、刷新，以显示最新内容。

examples.en: If the video freezes, try reloading the page.
examples.zh: 如果视频卡住了，试着刷新页面。

examples.en: Reload the app to see the latest messages.
examples.zh: 重新打开/刷新应用来查看最新消息。

extraExplanation: 在浏览器或应用里，reload 常对应 “刷新/重新加载”。常见按钮有 “Reload/Refresh”，快捷键通常是 Ctrl+R（Windows）或 Command+R（Mac）。
在游戏或枪械语境中，reload 特指 “装弹/补弹”。日常交流中如果不涉及武器，更常用 reload 表示 “刷新页面/重载程序”。

summary.en: “Reloaded” means loaded again, or (figuratively) refreshed/restarted; it’s also the past form of “reload.”
summary.zh: “reloaded”表示“重新装填/重新装载”，也可比喻“重新振作/刷新”；同时也是“reload”的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: (of a gun, device, or container) loaded again after being used or emptied.
definition.zh: （枪支、设备或容器）再次装填、重新装载（用过或空了之后再装上）。

examples.en: The officer checked that the weapon was reloaded before continuing.
examples.zh: 警官确认武器已重新装填后才继续行动。

examples.en: I reloaded the stapler with new staples.
examples.zh: 我给订书机重新装上了订书钉。

definition.en: (figurative) refreshed or restarted with new energy, ideas, or content.
definition.zh: （比喻）重新振作；“刷新”后以新的精力、想法或内容再出发。

examples.en: After a short break, the team came back reloaded and ready to work.
examples.zh: 短暂休息后，团队重新充电，准备继续工作。

examples.en: The app was updated and reloaded with new features.
examples.zh: 这个应用更新后重新加载了新功能。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of “reload”: to load again (especially ammunition, film, a webpage, etc.).
definition.zh: “reload”的过去式/过去分词：再次装填或重新加载（尤指弹药、胶卷、网页等）。

examples.en: I reloaded the page to see the latest comments.
examples.zh: 我刷新了页面来查看最新评论。

extraExplanation: “reload”在英语里最常见的字面语境是枪支/弹药（装填子弹）。在日常生活中也很常用来指“重新加载/刷新”（网页、应用、游戏存档等），以及更口语的比喻用法“充电、恢复状态”（reloaded = refreshed）。
你可能在流行文化中见过《The Matrix Reloaded》（《黑客帝国2：重装上阵》）。这里的“reloaded”利用了“重新装填武器”的意象，引申为“升级、再启动、再出发”的感觉。

summary.en: Reloader means a person who reloads (often ammunition) or a computing tool that automatically reloads when changes happen.
summary.zh: Reloader 指重新装填的人（常指装弹者），也可指计算机中自动重新加载的工具/功能。

definition.en: a person who reloads something; especially someone who reloads firearm ammunition (often as a hobby)
definition.zh: 重新装填某物的人；尤指给枪械弹药重新装填的人（常为一种爱好）

examples.en: My uncle is a reloader who makes his own ammunition to save money.
examples.zh: 我叔叔是个装弹者，会自己装弹来省钱。

examples.en: Many reloaders carefully measure powder for safety.
examples.zh: 许多装弹者会为安全起见仔细称量火药。

definition.en: (computing) a tool or feature that reloads a program, page, or data automatically when something changes
definition.zh: （计算机）在内容变化时自动重新加载程序、页面或数据的工具/功能

examples.en: During development, I use a reloader so the app updates instantly.
examples.zh: 开发时我用自动重载工具，让应用立刻更新。

examples.en: The server has a config reloader that applies changes without a full restart.
examples.zh: 服务器有配置重载器，不必完全重启就能应用更改。

extraExplanation: 在英语里，reloader 由动词 reload（重新装填/重新加载）+ -er（表示“做某事的人/物”）构成，所以既可以指“人”（装弹的人），也可以指“工具/程序”（自动重载器）。
在软件语境中，reloader 常见于开发工具（例如自动刷新网页、热重载/热更新等）；在枪械语境中，reloader 多与“handloading/handloader（手装弹）”相关，通常强调安全和精确。

summary.en: “Reloaders” are people (or sometimes tools) that reload ammunition or reload something again, like a device or webpage.
summary.zh: “Reloaders”指装填/自装弹的人；也可指用于重新装载或重载（如设备、网页）的工具或程序。

definition.en: a person who reloads ammunition (makes or refills cartridges), often as a hobby or for shooting sports
definition.zh: （弹药）装填者；自装弹的人（把子弹壳、火药、弹头等重新装配成弹药，常见于射击运动或爱好）

examples.en: Many reloaders make their own ammunition to reduce costs.
examples.zh: 很多自装弹的人自己装填弹药来降低成本。

examples.en: Experienced reloaders carefully measure powder for safety.
examples.zh: 有经验的装填者会仔细称量火药以确保安全。

definition.en: people or tools that reload something again (such as a device, a webpage, or a machine)
definition.zh: 重新装载者；重新加载的工具/程序（如设备、网页或机器的“重载/刷新”）

examples.en: If the video freezes, some reloaders will refresh the page automatically.
examples.zh: 如果视频卡住，一些重载工具会自动刷新页面。

examples.en: The machine uses automatic reloaders to keep production running.
examples.zh: 这台机器使用自动装载装置来保持生产运行。

extraExplanation: “reloader(s)”在英文里最常见的语境是枪械/射击领域，指自装弹爱好者（handloading/reloading）。在日常电脑语境中，更常说“refresh”或“reload the page”，而“reloader”多指某个工具或程序。

summary.en: “Reloading” means loading again—commonly used for weapons (adding ammunition) and for technology (reloading a page or app).
summary.zh: “reloading”指“重新装载/重新加载”，常见于武器（重新装填弹药）以及科技场景（刷新网页、重新加载应用）。

definition.en: loading something again, or putting a new supply into it (e.g., bullets into a gun, or data into a program)
definition.zh: 重新装载；再次补充（如给枪装子弹，或让程序重新载入数据）

examples.en: The officer paused for a moment, reloading his weapon.
examples.zh: 警官停顿了一下，给武器重新装弹。

examples.en: Try reloading the app if the page is blank.
examples.zh: 如果页面是空白的，试着重新载入这个应用。

definition.en: the act or process of loading again (especially ammunition); also, refreshing a web page or restarting an app to load content again
definition.zh: 重新装载的行为或过程（尤指重新装填弹药）；也指刷新网页或重启应用以重新加载内容

examples.en: Reloading takes practice if you want to do it quickly and safely.
examples.zh: 如果你想又快又安全地装填，重新装填需要练习。

examples.en: After reloading, the webpage finally showed the correct results.
examples.zh: 刷新后，网页终于显示了正确的结果。

definition.en: related to loading again; happening while something is being loaded again
definition.zh: 与重新装载有关的；正在重新加载时发生的

examples.en: A reloading screen appeared while the game updated.
examples.zh: 游戏更新时出现了重新加载的画面。

extraExplanation: 在科技语境里，reloading 常等同于 refresh（刷新页面）或 restart/reopen（重启/重新打开应用）。口语里更常说：“Reload the page.”
在枪械语境里，reload/reloading 指“重新装填弹药”。这是比较敏感且有安全风险的话题；在英文新闻、影视和游戏里很常见，但现实中涉及武器请务必遵守当地法律与安全规范。

summary.en: “Reloads” usually means “loads again” (ammo/supplies) or “refreshes and loads again” (a webpage/app).
summary.zh: “Reloads”通常表示“重新装载（弹药/补给）”，或“刷新并重新加载（网页/应用）”。

definition.en: (verb, third-person singular) to load again; to put new supplies (such as bullets, film, or data) into something so it can be used again
definition.zh: （动词第三人称单数）重新装载；把补给（如子弹、胶片或数据）再次装入，使其能继续使用

examples.en: He reloads the printer with paper every morning.
examples.zh: 他每天早上都会给打印机重新装纸。

examples.en: The soldier reloads his rifle quickly.
examples.zh: 士兵迅速给步枪重新装弹。

definition.en: (verb, third-person singular) to refresh and load a webpage, app, or document again (often to get new information)
definition.zh: （动词第三人称单数）刷新并重新加载网页、应用或文档（常为获取最新信息）

examples.en: She reloads the page to see the latest comments.
examples.zh: 她刷新页面查看最新评论。

examples.en: If the video freezes, the app reloads automatically.
examples.zh: 如果视频卡住，应用会自动重新加载。

definition.en: (noun, plural) new ammunition or supplies added again, especially in shooting or video games
definition.zh: （名词复数）再次补充的弹药/补给；（尤指）射击或电子游戏里的“补弹/换弹次数（或补给）”

examples.en: I’m out of reloads, so I have to switch weapons.
examples.zh: 我没有补弹次数了，只能换武器。

examples.en: This weapon has fast reloads.
examples.zh: 这把武器换弹很快。

extraExplanation: “reloads”通常是动词“reload”的第三人称单数（He/She/It reloads）。在游戏语境里也常用作名词复数，表示“补弹次数/补给次数”，具体含义取决于游戏规则。
与网页相关时，“reload”接近“refresh（刷新）”；在浏览器里常见表达：Reload the page / hit reload。

summary.en: Reloan means to lend again or renew/replace an earlier loan; it can also refer to the new loan itself.
summary.zh: reloan 指再次出借或对原贷款进行续贷/再贷款；也可指这笔新的贷款本身。

definition.en: to lend (money or something) again, or to make a new loan to replace or continue an earlier one
definition.zh: 再次出借；（尤指金融）续贷、再贷款（用新贷款替代或延续旧贷款）

examples.en: The bank agreed to reloan the funds for another year.
examples.zh: 银行同意把这笔资金续贷一年。

examples.en: They had trouble getting the money reloaned after the first contract ended.
examples.zh: 第一份合同结束后，他们很难再把这笔钱续借到。

definition.en: a new loan made to replace or renew a previous loan
definition.zh: 再贷款；续贷（替代或延续原有贷款的新贷款）

examples.en: The business survived because of a reloan at a lower interest rate.
examples.zh: 这家企业因获得较低利率的续贷而挺了过来。

extraExplanation: “reloan”在日常英语中不算特别常见，更常见的说法包括：动词用“renew a loan / refinance / make another loan”，名词用“loan renewal / refinancing / new loan”。在银行、企业融资、助学贷款等语境里，你更可能看到这些替代表达。

summary.en: “Reloaned” means “lent again” (money or an item).
summary.zh: “reloaned”表示“再次出借/再贷出（钱或物品）”。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of reloan) to lend money or something again, often after it was returned or repaid.
definition.zh: （reloan 的过去式/过去分词）再次出借（钱或物品），常指对方归还或还款后又借出。

examples.en: After she repaid the first amount, the bank reloaned the funds to her for the next project.
examples.zh: 她还清第一笔后，银行又把这笔资金再次贷给她用于下一个项目。

examples.en: The library reloaned the book to another student as soon as it was returned.
examples.zh: 那本书一归还，图书馆就把它再次借给了另一位学生。

extraExplanation:
“reloaned”常见于金融、贷款或图书馆借阅语境：
- 金融：指同一笔或相似资金再次放贷（有时也出现在“reloaned portfolio/loans”等搭配）。
- 图书馆：更口语/解释性表达，实际系统里常用“renewed（续借）”或“checked out again（再次借出）”。
注意不要和“renewed（续借，延长同一次借阅期限）”混淆：reloaned 更像“还了/归还后又借一次”。

summary.en: “Reloaning” means lending something again, or giving a new loan to replace/extend an old one.
summary.zh: “Reloaning”指再次出借某物，或在金融语境中对旧借款进行再贷款/续贷。

definition.en: the act of loaning something again (lending it a second time), or the process of giving a borrower a new loan to replace an earlier one
definition.zh: 再次出借（把某物再借出去一次）；或对原有借款进行再贷款/续贷（用一笔新贷款替换或延续旧贷款）

examples.en: The library system allows reloaning items if no one else has requested them.
examples.zh: 如果没有人预约，图书馆系统允许把借出的物品续借（再次出借）。

examples.en: The bank is reloaning the funds under new terms to help the business stay afloat.
examples.zh: 银行在新条款下进行再贷款，帮助企业渡过难关。

definition.en: loaning something again; lending again
definition.zh: 再次出借；再借出

examples.en: She is reloaning her notes to a classmate who missed the lecture.
examples.zh: 她把笔记再次借给了一个错过讲座的同学。

examples.en: The shop is reloaning refurbished equipment to customers on a monthly plan.
examples.zh: 这家店把翻新的设备再次出借给客户，按月付费。

extraExplanation:
“reloaning”多见于两类语境：
1）日常/机构借用：常等同于“renewing a loan（续借）”，尤其在图书馆系统里。
2）金融：指“reloan / relend（再贷款/再放贷）”，可能涉及展期、置换或重新定价等新条件。
实际写作中，如果你想表达“续借图书”，更常用“renewing”或“renewal”；“reloaning”偏少见但可理解。

summary.en: “Reloans” usually means loans made again or renewed/replaced loans; it can also be the verb form meaning “(someone) lends again.”
summary.zh: “Reloans”通常指再次发放/续作的贷款；也可作动词，表示“（某人）再次放贷”。

definition.en: plural of reloan: loans made again, especially when a lender lends the same funds again or replaces an old loan with a new one (refinancing).
definition.zh: reloan 的复数：再次发放的贷款；尤指把同一笔资金再次贷出，或用新贷款替换旧贷款（再融资/续贷）。

examples.en: The bank increased reloans to help small businesses manage cash flow.
examples.zh: 银行增加了续贷（再放贷）来帮助小企业周转资金。

examples.en: After the storm, many homeowners applied for reloans to repair their houses.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，许多房主申请续贷来修缮房屋。

definition.en: third-person singular of reloan: to lend money again, or to make a new loan to replace an existing one.
definition.zh: reloan 的第三人称单数：再次放贷；或用新贷款替换现有贷款。

examples.en: The credit union reloans the funds once the first borrower repays.
examples.zh: 第一位借款人还款后，信用合作社会将这笔资金再次贷出。

examples.en: If rates drop, the lender sometimes reloans the balance under a new contract.
examples.zh: 如果利率下降，放贷方有时会用新合同对余额进行再放贷（相当于再融资）。

extraExplanation: “reloan”多见于金融/银行语境，强调“再放贷”或“续贷/再融资”的动作或结果。日常英语里更常用的表达是“refinance”（再融资）或“renew a loan”（续贷），具体用哪个取决于是否更换合同、利率和期限。

summary.en: Relocable (rare) means able to be relocated or moved to a different place; “relocatable” is more common.
summary.zh: Relocable（较少见）指“可搬迁/可迁移的”；更常见的说法是“relocatable”。

definition.en: (Uncommon/nonstandard) able to be relocated; able to be moved to a new place.
definition.zh: （不常见/非标准用法）可搬迁的；可迁移到新地点的。

examples.en: We need a relocable office unit that can be moved to another site next year.
examples.zh: 我们需要一个可搬迁的办公室单元，明年可以搬到另一个工地。

examples.en: Temporary, relocable housing is often used after natural disasters.
examples.zh: 自然灾害之后常会使用临时的、可搬迁的住房。

extraExplanation: “relocable”在现代英语里不常见，很多情况下更常用、更自然的词是“relocatable”（可搬迁的）或“movable/portable”（可移动的/便携的）。在工程、建筑或政府文件中偶尔会看到“relocable”，但在一般写作中建议用“relocatable”。
词源上来自“relocate”（重新安置/搬迁）+ 形容词后缀“-able”（能够……的）。

summary.en: Relocatability means how able or willing someone is to move to another place, especially for work.
summary.zh: Relocatability 指一个人（或岗位）为工作等原因搬到别处的能力或意愿，即“可搬迁性/可调动性”。

definition.en: the ability or readiness of a person (or job/role) to move to a different place for work or living; how easy it is to relocate
definition.zh: （人或岗位的）可迁移性／可调动性；为工作或生活搬到别处的能力或意愿；搬迁的容易程度

examples.en: The company considers relatability, experience, and relocatability when hiring new managers.
examples.zh: 公司在招聘新经理时会考虑沟通能力、经验以及可调动性。

examples.en: Her relocatability is high because she has no fixed lease and can move quickly.
examples.zh: 她的可搬迁性很高，因为她没有固定租约，能很快搬走。

examples.en: The position requires strong relocatability within the United States.
examples.zh: 该职位要求在美国境内有较强的调动／搬迁意愿。

extraExplanation: “relocatability”常见于招聘（HR）、外派/调动、移民与签证讨论中，用来评价候选人是否愿意或是否具备条件搬到其他城市/国家。
构词：relocate（搬迁/调动）+ -ability（……的能力/可能性），语气偏正式，日常口语里更常说 “willingness to relocate / ability to relocate”。

summary.en: Relocatable means able to be moved or re-installed in a new place without much difficulty.
summary.zh: Relocatable 指“可搬迁/可移置的”，强调换地点后仍能方便地继续使用。

definition.en: Able to be moved to a new place or installed/used in a different location without major changes.
definition.zh: 可搬迁的；可移置的；可在不同地点安装/使用而无需大改的。

examples.en: The software is relocatable, so you can install it on another computer later.
examples.zh: 这款软件是可迁移的，所以你以后可以把它安装到另一台电脑上。

examples.en: They chose a relocatable office trailer while the main building was under construction.
examples.zh: 在主楼施工期间，他们选择了一个可移动的办公室拖车。

extraExplanation:
在科技与工程领域里，relocatable 很常见：例如“relocatable software（可迁移软件）”“relocatable building/house（可搬迁建筑/房屋）”。
语感上它比 movable 更正式，强调“搬到新地点后仍然能正常使用/运行”，而不仅仅是“能移动”。
词形来源：re-（再次/重新）+ locate（安置、定位）+ -able（能够……的），整体意思就是“能够重新安置到别处的”。

summary.en: Relocate means to move to a new place or to move something/someone to a new location, often in a formal or business context.
summary.zh: Relocate 指（人或机构）搬迁到新地点，或把某物/某人迁移到新位置，常用于较正式或商务语境。

definition.en: to move to a new place to live or work (often permanently or for a long period)
definition.zh: （通常指长期或永久地）搬迁；迁居；调动到新地点

examples.en: They relocated to Seattle for a new job.
examples.zh: 他们为了新工作搬到了西雅图。

examples.en: The company relocated its headquarters to Texas.
examples.zh: 这家公司把总部迁到了德克萨斯州。

definition.en: to move something to a different place; to place again in a new location
definition.zh: 将……迁移到别处；重新安置

examples.en: The museum relocated the painting to a safer room.
examples.zh: 博物馆把那幅画移到更安全的房间里。

examples.en: We had to relocate the meeting to a larger office.
examples.zh: 我们不得不把会议地点改到更大的办公室。

extraExplanation: “relocate”常用于正式或商务语境，比“move”更强调“搬到新的地点（尤其是因工作、政策、规划等原因）”。
常见搭配：relocate to + 地点（relocate to Boston）；relocate from A to B（从A搬到B）；relocate employees（调动员工）；relocation package（搬迁补贴/安置方案）。
词形提示：relocation (n. 搬迁/调动)；relocated (adj. 已搬迁的)；relocating (现在分词)。

summary.en: “Relocated” means moved to a new place (often in a formal context like jobs, offices, or resettlement).
summary.zh: “Relocated”表示“（较正式地）搬迁/调迁到新地方”，常用于工作、公司、安置等语境。

definition.en: moved to a new place (used as the past tense/past participle of “relocate”); often used for people, jobs, offices, or animals.
definition.zh: （relocate 的过去式/过去分词）搬迁到新地方；常用于人、工作、办公室、动物等。

examples.en: She relocated to Seattle for a new job.
examples.zh: 她为了新工作搬到了西雅图。

examples.en: The company relocated its headquarters last year.
examples.zh: 这家公司去年把总部搬迁了。

examples.en: After the storm, many families were relocated to safer areas.
examples.zh: 暴风雨后，许多家庭被安置/迁往更安全的地区。

definition.en: having been moved to a new place (used as an adjective).
definition.zh: 已被搬迁到新地方的（形容词用法）。

examples.en: The relocated office is closer to the subway.
examples.zh: 搬迁后的办公室离地铁更近。

examples.en: Relocated employees may receive a housing allowance.
examples.zh: 被调迁的员工可能会得到住房补贴。

extraExplanation: “relocate”比“move”更正式，常见于工作调动、公司搬迁、政府安置等语境；也常用于被动语态（be relocated）表示“被迁移/被安置”。
常见搭配：relocate to + 地点；relocate A to B（把A迁到B）；relocate a department/office/headquarters（搬迁部门/办公室/总部）。

summary.en: A relocatee is someone who has been moved to a new place to live or work, often by an organization or government.
summary.zh: relocatee 指被迁移到新地点居住或工作的人，常见于政府或机构安排的迁移语境。

definition.en: a person who is relocated (moved to a new place to live or work), especially by a government or organization
definition.zh: 被迁移者；被安置到新地点居住或工作的人（尤指由政府或机构安排迁移的人）

examples.en: After the flood, the relocatees were housed in temporary shelters.
examples.zh: 洪水过后，被迁移者被安置在临时避难所里。

examples.en: The company offered travel support for relocatees moving to the new office.
examples.zh: 公司为搬到新办公室的被调派迁居员工提供差旅补助。

extraExplanation: “relocatee”在历史语境中常指二战期间在美国被强制迁移并集中安置的日裔美国人（Japanese American relocatees），与“internment（拘禁/集中营）”等议题相关。写作或讨论时需注意其敏感背景，并尽量使用准确、尊重的表述（例如在需要时说明是“被强制迁移的日裔美国人”）。
构词法：relocate（重新安置/搬迁）+ -ee（表示“动作的承受者”，如 employee, evacuee）。因此 relocatee 强调“被迁移的人”。

summary.en: “Relocates” means “moves to a new place” or “moves someone/something to a new place.”
summary.zh: “relocates”表示“搬到新地方”或“把某人/某物迁到新地方”。

definition.en: moves to a new place to live or work (third-person singular of “relocate”)
definition.zh: 搬迁到新地点居住或工作（“relocate”的第三人称单数）

examples.en: She relocates to Chicago for a new job.
examples.zh: 她为了新工作搬到芝加哥。

examples.en: Our team relocates every two years.
examples.zh: 我们团队每两年搬迁一次。

definition.en: moves someone or something to a different place (third-person singular of “relocate”)
definition.zh: 把某人或某物迁移到另一个地方（“relocate”的第三人称单数）

examples.en: The company relocates its headquarters next month.
examples.zh: 公司下个月将总部迁到别处。

examples.en: The city relocates families after the flood.
examples.zh: 洪水过后，城市将一些家庭安置到别处。

extraExplanation: “relocate”常用于比较正式或商务语境（例如公司调动、总部迁移、灾后安置）；日常口语里更常说“move”。另外，“relocate”强调“换到新的地点并在那儿重新安顿/开展”，语气比“move”更计划性、更正式。

summary.en: “Relocating” means moving to a new place (often for work or business), or describing people/things that are in the process of moving.
summary.zh: “relocating”表示搬到新地方（常因工作/公司业务），也可作形容词表示“正在搬迁中的/与搬迁有关的”。

definition.en: moving to a new place to live, work, or operate (present participle/gerund of “relocate”).
definition.zh: 搬迁；迁居；迁移（“relocate”的现在分词/动名词，用于表示正在或计划中的迁移）。

examples.en: We’re relocating to Seattle for my job.
examples.zh: 我们要因为我的工作搬到西雅图。

examples.en: The company is relocating its headquarters next year.
examples.zh: 公司计划明年把总部迁走。

examples.en: Relocating can be stressful, but planning early helps.
examples.zh: 搬家/搬迁可能很有压力，但早点规划会有帮助。

definition.en: in the process of being moved to a new location; connected with a move.
definition.zh: 正在迁移中的；与搬迁有关的。

examples.en: Relocating families may need temporary housing.
examples.zh: 正在搬迁的家庭可能需要临时住房。

examples.en: We support relocating employees with travel and moving costs.
examples.zh: 我们为外派/搬迁员工提供差旅和搬家费用支持。

extraExplanation: “relocate”比“move”更正式，常用于工作调动、公司搬迁、机构迁址等场景：relocate employees / relocate a factory / relocation package（搬迁补贴、安置方案）。
常见搭配：relocating to + 地点（搬到……）；relocating from A to B（从A迁到B）；relocating for work/school（因工作/上学而搬）。

summary.en: Relocation means moving to a new place (especially for work) or moving an organization/facility to another location.
summary.zh: Relocation 指（尤指因工作）搬迁/迁居，也可指企业、设施等迁址。

definition.en: the act of moving to a new place to live or work; a move to a different location
definition.zh: 搬迁；迁居；调动（到新地点居住或工作）的行为

examples.en: The company offered a relocation package to help employees move to another city.
examples.zh: 公司提供了搬迁补贴/安置方案，帮助员工搬到另一个城市。

examples.en: International relocation can take months of planning.
examples.zh: 国际搬迁可能需要几个月的规划。

examples.en: After the flood, many families needed temporary relocation.
examples.zh: 洪水过后，许多家庭需要临时安置/暂时搬迁。

definition.en: the process of moving something (such as a business, office, or equipment) to a different place
definition.zh: （把企业、办公室、设备等）迁移到别处的过程

examples.en: The relocation of the factory reduced costs but changed the local economy.
examples.zh: 工厂迁址降低了成本，但也改变了当地经济。

examples.en: IT relocation requires careful backups and downtime planning.
examples.zh: IT设备迁移需要仔细备份并规划停机时间。

extraExplanation: “Relocation”在职场英语里非常常见，尤其指公司把员工“调到外地/外派”时提供的支持，常见搭配：relocation package（搬迁福利/安置方案）、relocation allowance（搬迁补贴）、relocation assistance（搬迁协助）。
词源上来自 re-（再次/重新）+ location（地点）。日常口语里人搬家更常说 move / moving；relocation更正式、书面或商务语境。

summary.en: “Relocations” means moves to a new place—often for work, housing, or safety reasons.
summary.zh: “Relocations”指搬迁/迁移到新地点，常因工作、住房或安全等原因。

definition.en: the acts or processes of moving people, offices, or things to a new place; instances of being moved
definition.zh: 搬迁；迁移；调动（把人、办公室或物品搬到新地点的过程或一次搬迁）

examples.en: The company announced several relocations to lower-cost cities.
examples.zh: 公司宣布将进行多次搬迁，迁往成本更低的城市。

examples.en: After the storm, families faced temporary relocations while repairs were made.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，房屋维修期间，许多家庭不得不临时搬离。

examples.en: International relocations often require visas, housing searches, and school planning.
examples.zh: 国际搬迁通常需要办理签证、找房子并安排孩子入学。

extraExplanation: “relocations”是“relocation”的复数形式。日常与职场语境中常指公司/员工的“工作调动与搬家”，也可指灾害、战争、城市改造等导致的“迁移/安置”。
常见搭配：corporate relocations（公司搬迁/员工外派搬迁）、forced relocations（强制迁移）、temporary relocations（临时搬离）、relocation package（搬迁补贴/安置福利）。

summary.en: A relocator is someone (or sometimes a company) that helps people or businesses move to a new place.
summary.zh: relocator 指协助个人或企业搬到新地点的人或机构（偶尔也指移动装置）。

definition.en: a person or company that helps move people, goods, or operations to a new place; someone whose job is to relocate others
definition.zh: 搬迁服务者；协助个人或公司把人、物品或业务迁移到新地点的人或机构

examples.en: The company hired a relocator to manage the employee’s move from Chicago to Seattle.
examples.zh: 公司雇了搬迁服务机构来负责员工从芝加哥搬到西雅图的事。

examples.en: As a corporate relocator, she arranges housing, schools, and moving services for families.
examples.zh: 作为企业搬迁顾问，她会为家庭安排住房、学校和搬家服务。

definition.en: a device, tool, or part used to move something to a different position (less common)
definition.zh: （较少见）用于把某物移到另一位置的装置或部件

examples.en: The technician used a small relocator to shift the sensor into the correct spot.
examples.zh: 技术人员用一个小型定位移动装置把传感器移到正确位置。

extraExplanation: “relocator”来自动词“relocate”（重新安置/搬迁）+ 表示人的后缀“-or”。在美国职场语境里，常见于“corporate relocator（企业搬迁服务商/顾问）”“relocation package（搬迁福利）”等说法。

summary.en: Relock means to lock something again after it has been unlocked or opened.
summary.zh: Relock 指在解锁或打开之后，再次把某物锁上。

definition.en: to lock something again after it has been opened or unlocked
definition.zh: （把……）再次上锁；重新锁上

examples.en: Please relock the door when you come back inside.
examples.zh: 你回到屋里后请把门重新锁上。

examples.en: After checking the window, he relocked it for safety.
examples.zh: 检查完窗户后，他为了安全把窗户又锁好了。

definition.en: to become locked again (less common; often phrased as “lock again”)
definition.zh: 再次锁上（较少见；常说 lock again）

examples.en: The latch didn’t relock, so the gate stayed open.
examples.zh: 门闩没有再次锁住，所以大门一直开着。

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再次、重新”。所以 relock = re-（再次）+ lock（锁）。日常口语里也常说 lock it again。

summary.en: “Relocked” means “locked again” (past tense/past participle of relock).
summary.zh: “relocked”表示“再次上锁”（relock 的过去式/过去分词）。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “relock”: to lock again after it was opened or unlocked.
definition.zh: “relock”的过去式和过去分词：把已经打开或解锁的东西再次上锁。

examples.en: After checking the door, she relocked it before leaving.
examples.zh: 检查完门后，她离开前又把门重新锁上了。

examples.en: The guard relocked the gate once everyone was inside.
examples.zh: 所有人都进去后，保安把大门再次锁上了。

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再一次/重新”。所以 relock = re-（再）+ lock（锁上）。日常写作里也常见同义表达：lock again / lock it back up。

summary.en: “Relocks” means locks something again; it can also be the he/she/it form of “relock.”
summary.zh: “relocks”表示把某物再次锁上；也可以是“relock”的第三人称单数形式。

definition.en: to lock something again (after it has been opened or unlocked)
definition.zh: （在打开或解锁后）再次把某物锁上

examples.en: Please relock the door when you come back inside.
examples.zh: 你回到屋里后请把门再锁上。

examples.en: He checked the window, closed it, and relocked it.
examples.zh: 他检查了窗户，把它关上并重新锁好。

definition.en: third-person singular present form of “relock” (used with he/she/it)
definition.zh: “relock”的一般现在时第三人称单数形式（用于 he/she/it）

examples.en: She relocks the gate every night before bed.
examples.zh: 她每天睡前都会把大门重新锁好。

extraExplanation: “re-”这个前缀表示“再次、重新”。所以 relock = lock again。类似的常见词：reopen（重新打开）、rewrite（重写）、recheck（复查）。

summary.en: Relodge means to house or place someone/something again, often in a different location.
summary.zh: Relodge指把人或物再次安置/重新安排住处，常含“换到别处”的意思。

definition.en: to lodge or place someone/something again, especially in a new place; to rehouse
definition.zh: （把人/物）再次安置、重新安顿（尤指换到新地方）；重新安置（住房）

examples.en: After the fire, the city relodged the families in nearby apartments.
examples.zh: 火灾后，市政府把这些家庭重新安置到附近的公寓里。

examples.en: The hotel relodged us in a quieter room because of the noise.
examples.zh: 因为太吵，酒店把我们重新安排到更安静的房间。

examples.en: They had to relodge the rescued animals at a different shelter.
examples.zh: 他们不得不把获救的动物重新安置到另一个收容所。

extraExplanation: “relodge”在现代英语里比较少见，写作中更常用“rehouse”“relocate”“put up (temporarily)”等表达。
词源构成是“re-”（再、重新）+“lodge”（寄宿/安置）。在英式语境中，“lodge”也常指“临时住宿”或“提供住处”，因此“relodge”带有“重新安排住处”的意思。

summary.en: Relong is a rare word meaning “oblong/longer than wide,” and very rarely “to lengthen.”
summary.zh: relong 是个罕见词，常指“长于宽的（长方形的）”，极少也可作动词表示“使变长/加长”。

definition.en: (Rare, technical) Oblong; longer than it is wide.
definition.zh: （罕见；偏专业）长方形的；长于宽的。

examples.en: The shield is described as relong in old heraldry manuals.
examples.zh: 在古老的纹章学手册里，这种盾形被描述为 relong（长于宽）。

examples.en: A relong table fits better in a narrow dining room.
examples.zh: 长于宽的（relong）餐桌更适合狭长的餐厅。

definition.en: (Very rare) To make longer; to lengthen.
definition.zh: （非常罕见）使变长；加长。

examples.en: They tried to relong the strap so it would fit.
examples.zh: 他们试着把带子加长，好让它合适。

extraExplanation: “relong”在现代英语中非常少见，更多出现在旧式/专业语境（如纹章学、形状描述）里，意思接近“oblong（长方形的）”。日常英语更常用：oblong / rectangular（形状）；lengthen / elongate / extend（动词：加长）。
很多学习者会把它看成拼写错误；如果你原本想表达“延长时间”，更自然的词通常是“prolong / extend”。

summary.en: Relook means to look at something again, usually to check or reconsider.
summary.zh: relook 表示“再看一遍/重新查看”，多用于核对或重新考虑。

definition.en: to look at something again, often to check details or reconsider
definition.zh: 再看一遍；重新查看（常用于核对细节或重新考虑）

examples.en: Can you relook at the email before you send it?
examples.zh: 你能在发送前再检查一下那封邮件吗？

examples.en: I had to relook at the map because I took a wrong turn.
examples.zh: 我走错了路，所以得再看一次地图。

definition.en: a second look; another look at something (less common, often written as “re-look”)
definition.zh: 再看一次；复看（较少见，常写作“re-look”）

examples.en: Let’s take a re-look at the budget numbers.
examples.zh: 我们再看一遍预算数字吧。

extraExplanation: “relook”在口语和非正式写作中常见，但更正式或更自然的表达通常是“look again / take another look / review / double-check”。
作名词时常写作“re-look”（带连字符）以更清晰地表示“再次观看/再看一眼”的含义。

summary.en: “Relose” means to lose again, especially after getting something back (rare).
summary.zh: “relose”表示“再次失去”，尤其指找回后又失去（较少用）。

definition.en: to lose again; to lose something that you had regained or recovered (rare)
definition.zh: 再次失去；把已经找回或重新获得的东西又失去（较少用）

examples.en: After months of recovery, he relost his confidence during the final exam.
examples.zh: 经过几个月的恢复，他在期末考试中又失去了信心。

examples.en: They found the old documents, only to relose them in the move.
examples.zh: 他们找到了那些旧文件，却在搬家时又把它们弄丢了。

extraExplanation: “relose”在现代英语中很少见，更常用的表达是“lose again”或“lose … again”。在写作中使用“relose”会显得更书面或更罕见。
注意拼写：有人会误写成“reloose”（通常不被视为标准用法）。

summary.en: “Relosing” means losing something again after getting it back.
summary.zh: “relosing”指在找回或重新获得之后，又再次失去。

definition.en: present participle of relose: losing something again after you had regained or found it.
definition.zh: relose 的现在分词：指把已经找回、重新获得的东西再次失去。

examples.en: I finally found my keys, but I ended up relosing them the next day.
examples.zh: 我终于找到钥匙了，但第二天又把它们弄丢了。

examples.en: After regaining control of the project, the team worried about relosing momentum.
examples.zh: 在重新掌控项目后，团队担心会再次失去动力。

extraExplanation: “relose / relosing”在日常英语中不算常见，更常用的表达是“lose again”“lose it again”。
注意不要和拼写相近的“releasing（释放、发布）”混淆：releasing 来自 release，意思完全不同。

summary.en: “Relost” means “lost again,” and it’s uncommon in everyday English (people often say “lost again”).
summary.zh: “relost”意思是“再次丢失/再次迷失”，日常英语里不太常用，常说“lost again”。

definition.en: lost again; having become lost a second time (or after being found).
definition.zh: 再次丢失的；重新迷失的（找回后又丢了/又迷路了）。

examples.en: I found my keys, then relost them an hour later.
examples.zh: 我找到钥匙了，但一小时后又把它弄丢了。

examples.en: The hikers were safe for a moment, then relost in the fog.
examples.zh: 徒步者一度安全了，但又在浓雾中再次迷失。

definition.en: to lose again (rare).
definition.zh: 再次失去；再弄丢（较少见）。

examples.en: Try not to relost the receipt—you’ll need it for a return.
examples.zh: 尽量别把收据又弄丢了——退货时要用。

extraExplanation: “relost”通常是由前缀 re-（“再次”）+ lost 组合出来的词，表示“又丢了/又迷失”。在现代日常英语里更常见的说法是“lost again”或“got lost again”。
在文学或叙事中，relost 有时会用来营造一种“刚找回希望又失去”的节奏感。

summary.en: Relot means to assign lots again—often to repartition land into new lots—or to reselect by drawing lots.
summary.zh: Relot 指“重新抽签分配”或（常见于规划/测绘）“重新划分并分配地块”。

definition.en: to assign by lot again; to redistribute or reallocate parcels/plots (especially land) into new lots
definition.zh: 重新抽签分配；（尤指土地）重新划分地块、重新分配地段

examples.en: The city decided to relot the neighborhood after the new road plan was approved.
examples.zh: 新道路规划获批后，市政府决定对该社区重新划分地块。

examples.en: After the survey, the farmland was relotted into smaller plots for each family.
examples.zh: 测量之后，农田被重新划分成更小的地块分给各家。

definition.en: to draw lots again; to make a new selection by chance
definition.zh: 再次抽签；用随机方式重新决定

examples.en: If two teams are tied, they may relot to decide who goes first.
examples.zh: 如果两队打成平局，可能会再次抽签决定谁先开始。

extraExplanation: “relot”比较少见，常见于土地测绘/城市规划语境：lot 指“地块、用地单位”，relot 就是“重新划分地块（重新分lot）”。在日常英语里更常用 redivide / rezone / reallocate / redistribute 等。

summary.en: “Relove” means “to love again,” but it’s rare and often sounds nonstandard; common alternatives are “fall in love again” or “love again.”
summary.zh: “relove”表示“再次去爱/重新爱上”，但较少见且常被视为非标准表达；更常用的是“fall in love again”或“love again”。

definition.en: to love again; to return to loving someone or something (nonstandard/rare usage).
definition.zh: 再次去爱；重新爱上某人或某物（非标准/较少见用法）。

examples.en: After years apart, they slowly began to relove each other.
examples.zh: 分开多年后，他们慢慢又重新爱上了彼此。

examples.en: I had to relove my city after I moved back.
examples.zh: 搬回来之后，我得重新爱上这座城市。

extraExplanation: “relove”在现代英语中不是常见的标准词，更多是写作者为了表达“再次去爱/重新爱上”而临时造出的用法。日常更自然的说法包括：“fall in love again (with...) / love again / learn to love ... again”。
构词上可理解为前缀 re-（再次）+ love（爱），意思直观，但正式写作中可能显得不够地道。

summary.en: Relower (often written re-lower) means to lower something again, or to go down again.
summary.zh: Relower（常写作 re-lower）意思是“再次降低/降下”，也可指“再次下降”。

definition.en: to lower again; to make something go down to a lower level or position after it has been raised
definition.zh: 再次降低；把某物在升高后再降下来

examples.en: After the storm passed, the crew re-lowered the flag to half-staff.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过去后，工作人员把旗帜再次降到半旗。

examples.en: Please re-lower the chair if it feels too high.
examples.zh: 如果你觉得椅子太高，请把它再调低一点。

definition.en: to go down again to a lower level or position
definition.zh: 再次下降到较低的位置或水平

examples.en: When the elevator reached the top floor, it briefly stopped and then re-lowered.
examples.zh: 电梯到达顶层后短暂停了一下，然后又下降了。

extraExplanation: “relower”更常见的写法是带连字符的“re-lower”，含义直观：re-（再一次）+ lower（降低）。
这个词在日常口语中不算常用；更自然的替代表达常见有：lower it again / bring it back down / lower it back down。

summary.en: Relubricate means to lubricate something again so it works smoothly.
summary.zh: relubricate 指“再次润滑（重新上油）”，让物件运转更顺畅。

definition.en: to lubricate something again, usually to reduce friction, prevent wear, or make it work smoothly after cleaning or heavy use
definition.zh: 再次给（某物）上润滑剂；重新润滑，通常为了减少摩擦、防止磨损或让机器更顺畅运转

examples.en: After cleaning the bike chain, relubricate it to keep the gears shifting smoothly.
examples.zh: 清洁完自行车链条后，要重新上油，才能让变速更顺畅。

examples.en: The technician relubricated the door hinges because they were squeaking.
examples.zh: 门轴在吱吱作响，所以技师给它重新润滑了。

examples.en: If the machine runs dry, shut it down and relubricate the moving parts.
examples.zh: 如果机器缺油运转，先停机，再给运动部件重新润滑。

extraExplanation: relubricate = re-（再次）+ lubricate（润滑）。多用于维修、保养、机械操作说明中，强调“清洁/使用后再上油”。
在日常口语中也可以说 “lubricate it again” 或 “re-oil it”（更口语，常指用油）。

summary.en: Relubricated means “lubricated again,” usually as part of maintenance to reduce friction.
summary.zh: Relubricated 意为“再次润滑/重新上油”，多用于维护保养以减少摩擦。

definition.en: lubricated again; added new oil/grease to a machine or part to reduce friction after the old lubricant wore off or was removed
definition.zh: 再次润滑；在旧润滑剂失效或被清除后，重新给机器或零件加油/加润滑脂以减少摩擦

examples.en: The technician relubricated the bearings before starting the motor.
examples.zh: 技师在启动电机前重新给轴承润滑。

examples.en: After cleaning the chain, I relubricated it to prevent squeaking.
examples.zh: 清洁链条后，我重新给它上油，防止吱吱作响。

definition.en: having been lubricated again (used as a past participle or adjective)
definition.zh: 已再次润滑的（作过去分词或形容词用）

examples.en: Once relubricated, the hinge moved smoothly.
examples.zh: 重新润滑后，合页转动很顺畅。

extraExplanation: 构词：re- 表示“再次/重新”，lubricate 表示“润滑”。所以 relubricate = 重新润滑，relubricated 是它的过去式/过去分词。
常见语境：机械维护、汽车/自行车保养、工业设备。通常是先清洁旧油泥或灰尘，再重新上油或润滑脂。

summary.en: “Relubricating” means putting lubricant on something again to reduce friction and keep it running smoothly.
summary.zh: “Relubricating”指再次给某物加润滑剂，以减少摩擦并保持顺畅运转。

definition.en: applying lubricant (oil, grease, etc.) again to a machine or moving part so it runs smoothly and with less friction
definition.zh: 再次给机器或活动部件加润滑剂（机油、润滑脂等），以减少摩擦并让运转更顺畅

examples.en: I’m relubricating the bike chain because it started to squeak.
examples.zh: 我在给自行车链条重新上油，因为它开始吱吱响了。

examples.en: The technician is relubricating the bearings after cleaning them.
examples.zh: 技师在清洗轴承后正在重新加润滑。

examples.en: We’re relubricating the hinges to stop the door from sticking.
examples.zh: 我们在给铰链重新润滑，防止门卡住。

extraExplanation: “relubricating”是动词“relubricate”的现在分词/动名词形式，常用于说明正在进行的维护动作（be relubricating）或作为名词用法（Relubricating helps prevent wear）。
多见于机械维护语境（自行车链条、轴承、齿轮、铰链等）。通常暗示“之前润滑过，但润滑失效/被清洁掉/使用后需要补充”，因此比“lubricating”更强调“再次”。
常见搭配：relubricate the chain/bearings/hinges; relubricate after cleaning; relubricate periodically (定期重新润滑)。

summary.en: Reduce means to make something less or smaller, or to simplify; it’s also used for thickening liquids in cooking.
summary.zh: Reduce 表示“减少/降低”或“简化”；在烹饪中也可指“收汁、熬浓”。

definition.en: to make something smaller in amount, size, number, or degree; to lessen
definition.zh: 减少；降低（数量、规模、程度等）

examples.en: We need to reduce costs this year.
examples.zh: 我们今年需要降低成本。

examples.en: Try to reduce the amount of sugar you eat.
examples.zh: 尽量减少你摄入的糖分。

definition.en: to bring something down to a simpler form, lower level, or easier condition
definition.zh: 使简化；使降到较低水平；使变得更容易处理

examples.en: The teacher reduced the problem to three simple steps.
examples.zh: 老师把问题简化成三个简单步骤。

examples.en: The city plans to reduce traffic by improving public transit.
examples.zh: 这座城市计划通过改善公共交通来减少交通拥堵。

definition.en: (in cooking) to boil a liquid so that some water evaporates and the flavor becomes stronger
definition.zh: （烹饪）收汁；熬浓（让液体蒸发变浓）

examples.en: Reduce the sauce for five minutes, then add butter.
examples.zh: 把酱汁收五分钟，再加入黄油。

definition.en: (math/science) to change to a simpler, equivalent form or a lower state
definition.zh: （数理/科学）化简；还原/降到更低状态

examples.en: Reduce the fraction 6/8 to 3/4.
examples.zh: 把分数 6/8 化简为 3/4。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“reluce”很可能是拼写错误，常见目标词是 **reduce**。
另外，英语里确实有一个非常少见的动词 **reluce**（意为“反射光、闪耀”），但在现代日常英语中几乎不用；学习和使用时通常应以 **reduce** 为准。

summary.en: Relucent means “shining” or “reflecting light,” but it is a rare, literary word.
summary.zh: Relucent 意为“发光的/反光的”，但在现代英语中较少见，多用于文学表达。

definition.en: shining; reflecting light; bright (rare literary word).
definition.zh: 发光的；反射光的；明亮的（较少见的文学用词）。

examples.en: The relucent surface of the lake mirrored the moon.
examples.zh: 湖面闪着反光，把月亮映了出来。

examples.en: In the poem, a relucent shield gleams in the dark.
examples.zh: 在诗里，一面发光的盾牌在黑暗中闪耀。

extraExplanation: “relucent”在现代英语中非常少见，多见于文学或修辞性写作，意思接近“发亮、反光”。
它常被误拼或误认成“reluctant（不情愿的）”。如果你本来想表达“勉强、不愿意”，更可能要用“reluctant”。
词源上与拉丁语中表示“发光/闪耀”的词根有关；现代更常用的近义词包括“shining / gleaming / luminous”。

summary.en: “Reluct” is a rare formal verb meaning to be unwilling or hesitant, often replaced today by “be reluctant” or “reluctance.”
summary.zh: “reluct”是较少见的正式动词，表示不情愿或犹豫；现代英语多用“be reluctant”或名词“reluctance”。

definition.en: (Rare, formal) To be unwilling to do something; to hesitate or resist.
definition.zh: （少见，较正式）不愿意做某事；犹豫或抗拒。

examples.en: He seemed to reluct when asked to speak in public.
examples.zh: 当被要求当众发言时，他似乎有些不情愿。

examples.en: She did not reluct to help, but she needed more time.
examples.zh: 她并非不愿帮忙，只是需要更多时间。

extraExplanation: “reluct”作为动词在现代英语中非常少见，更多时候人们会用更常见的表达：be reluctant to do sth（不情愿做某事）、reluctance（n. 不情愿）。
常见搭配：be reluctant to + 动词原形（I’m reluctant to agree. 我不太愿意同意）。
词源上与拉丁语“reluctari”（反抗、抵抗）有关，因此带有“内心抗拒/不情愿”的意味。

summary.en: Reluctance means a hesitant unwillingness to do something.
summary.zh: reluctance 指“犹豫、不情愿”，内心不太想做某事。

definition.en: Unwillingness or hesitation to do something; a feeling of not wanting to act.
definition.zh: 不情愿；犹豫；勉强（去做某事的心理状态）。

examples.en: She agreed with some reluctance because she was tired.
examples.zh: 她因为太累而勉强同意了。

examples.en: There was reluctance among the staff to change the old system.
examples.zh: 员工们对改变旧制度普遍有些抵触和犹豫。

extraExplanation: reluctance 常用于较正式的语境，强调“内心不太愿意但可能还是会做”。如果是更强烈的“不愿意/反对”，可以用 resistance 或 refusal；如果只是“有点紧张不敢”，有时用 hesitation 更贴近。
常见搭配：with reluctance（勉强地）、show/express reluctance（表现出不情愿）、reluctance to do sth（不愿做某事）。

summary.en: Reluctancy means unwillingness or hesitation to do something (more commonly written as “reluctance”).
summary.zh: Reluctancy 指“不情愿或犹豫去做某事”（现代英语更常用 reluctance）。

definition.en: A feeling of unwillingness or hesitation to do something; not wanting to act even if you may need to.
definition.zh: 不情愿；勉强；犹豫（做某事时内心不愿意或迟疑）。

examples.en: She spoke with reluctancy about her past.
examples.zh: 她谈到自己的过去时显得很不情愿。

examples.en: There was some reluctancy to change the plan at the last minute.
examples.zh: 临时要改计划，大家有些犹豫和不情愿。

examples.en: His reluctancy to ask for help made things harder.
examples.zh: 他不情愿开口求助，让事情更难了。

extraExplanation: “Reluctancy”和“reluctance”都表示“不情愿/犹豫”，但在现代英语中更常用、更自然的是“reluctance”。“Reluctancy”也能用，但会显得更少见或更正式。
常见搭配：reluctance/reluctancy to do sth（不情愿做某事）；with reluctance（勉强地）。
相关形容词：reluctant（不情愿的）。例如：He is reluctant to apologize.（他不情愿道歉。）

summary.en: Reluctant means hesitant or not willing to do something, often because you feel unsure or uncomfortable.
summary.zh: reluctant 表示“犹豫、不情愿、勉强”，常用于描述不太愿意去做某事。

definition.en: Not willing or eager to do something; hesitant because you are unsure, afraid, or not interested.
definition.zh: 不情愿的；勉强的；犹豫的（因为不确定、害怕或不感兴趣）。

examples.en: She was reluctant to speak in front of the class.
examples.zh: 她不太愿意在全班面前发言。

examples.en: I’m reluctant to buy it online because I can’t try it on.
examples.zh: 我不太想在网上买，因为我不能试穿。

examples.en: After some discussion, he reluctantly agreed to help.
examples.zh: 讨论了一会儿后，他勉强同意帮忙。

definition.en: (Reluctant + to do / about something) Showing resistance; slow to act or accept an idea.
definition.zh: （reluctant to do / about sth）表示抗拒；不太愿意行动或接受某个想法。

examples.en: The company was reluctant to change its policy.
examples.zh: 公司不太愿意改变政策。

examples.en: He’s reluctant about moving to a new city.
examples.zh: 他对搬去新城市有些抗拒。

extraExplanation: 用法提示：常见搭配是 “be reluctant to + 动词原形” 或 “be reluctant about + 名词/动名词”。语气上比 “unwilling” 更委婉，强调“犹豫/不情愿”，不一定是强烈拒绝。
词汇关联：reluctantly 是副词（勉强地）；reluctance 是名词（不情愿、犹豫）。
文学语感：在叙事或描写人物心理时，reluctant 常用来表现人物“心里不太愿意但又不得不做”的矛盾感。

summary.en: “Reluctantly” means doing something unwillingly or with hesitation.
summary.zh: “reluctantly”表示做某事时不情愿、勉强或带着犹豫。

definition.en: In a way that shows you are unwilling, hesitant, or not happy to do something, even though you do it.
definition.zh: 不情愿地；勉强地；带着犹豫或不乐意的态度去做某事（但还是做了）。

examples.en: She reluctantly agreed to help, even though she was exhausted.
examples.zh: 尽管她已经筋疲力尽，她还是不情愿地同意帮忙。

examples.en: He reluctantly apologized after the teacher asked him to.
examples.zh: 在老师要求之后，他才勉强道了歉。

examples.en: Reluctantly, I packed my bags and left the city.
examples.zh: 我不情愿地收拾行李，离开了这座城市。

extraExplanation: 词形关系：reluctant（adj. 不情愿的）→ reluctantly（adv. 不情愿地）。常见搭配有：reluctantly agree/accept/admit/apologize/go/leave。
语气区别：reluctantly 更强调“内心不愿意但还是做了”；如果只是“犹豫、拿不定主意”，也常用 hesitantly。

summary.en: *Reluctari* is a Latin verb meaning “to struggle against; resist,” mainly seen in academic or literary quotations.
summary.zh: *Reluctari* 是拉丁语动词，意为“挣扎反抗、抵抗”，主要出现在学术或文学引文中。

definition.en: (Latin; used in scholarly or literary contexts) to struggle against; to resist; to fight back.
definition.zh: （拉丁语；多见于学术或文学语境）挣扎反抗；抵抗；对抗。

examples.en: In classical Latin, *reluctari* means “to struggle against” an opposing force.
examples.zh: 在古典拉丁语中，*reluctari* 的意思是“与对立力量挣扎对抗”。

examples.en: The poet describes the hero as *reluctari*—fighting against fate itself.
examples.zh: 诗人把英雄写成 *reluctari*——与命运本身抗争。

extraExplanation: *reluctari* 来自拉丁语动词 *reluctor, reluctari*（常见为“反抗、抵抗”之意）。英语里的 **reluctant**（不情愿的）和 **reluctance**（不情愿）与它同源：都带有“内心在抗拒/不想做”的感觉。
它不是现代英语常用词；更常见于古典学、法律史、神学或文学评论中作为拉丁引文出现。若你想表达日常英语里的意思，通常用 **resist**（抵抗）或 **be reluctant to**（不情愿做）。

summary.en: Reluctate is a rare, old-fashioned verb meaning “to struggle against; to resist.”
summary.zh: reluctate 是一个罕见且较古老的动词，意思是“奋力抵抗、反抗”。

definition.en: to struggle against; to resist or oppose (often in a physical or forceful way).
definition.zh: 与……搏斗；奋力抵抗、反抗（常带有较强的对抗或挣扎意味）。

examples.en: The patient began to reluctate against the restraints.
examples.zh: 病人开始奋力挣扎，试图摆脱束缚带。

examples.en: In older texts, the hero reluctates against fate itself.
examples.zh: 在较早的文本里，英雄会与命运本身奋力抗争。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常少见、偏古典（archaic），现代英语里更常用 resist、struggle (against)、fight (against)、oppose 等来表达同样意思。
词源来自拉丁语 reluctari（意为“反抗、挣扎”）。它与 reluctant（不情愿的）在词源上有关：reluctant 本意也带有“内心在抗拒”的感觉，但现代用法主要指“勉强、不太愿意”。

summary.en: “Reluctation” is rare; most people mean “reluctance,” meaning hesitation or unwillingness.
summary.zh: “reluctation”很少用；大多数情况下想表达的是“reluctance”，意思是犹豫或不情愿。

definition.en: (Commonly intended word) reluctance: unwillingness or hesitation to do something.
definition.zh: （常见想表达的词）reluctance：不情愿；犹豫，不太愿意去做某事。

examples.en: She showed reluctance to speak in front of the class.
examples.zh: 她不太愿意在全班同学面前发言。

examples.en: With some reluctance, he agreed to help.
examples.zh: 他有些不情愿地同意帮忙。

definition.en: (Rare/archaic) reluctation: the act of struggling against something; resistance.
definition.zh: （罕见/古旧）reluctation：反抗、挣扎；对某事的抵抗。

examples.en: The report mentioned public reluctation against the new rule.
examples.zh: 报告提到公众对新规定的抵触。

extraExplanation: “reluctation”在现代英语里非常少见，很多时候是把更常用的“reluctance”拼错了。日常写作与考试中，建议优先用“reluctance”。
词根小提示：reluctance 来自拉丁语 reluctari（= to struggle against，反抗/抗拒）。因此它既可以表示“心理上的不情愿”，也保留了一点“抵抗”的感觉。

summary.en: “Relucted” is a rare/nonstandard past tense of “reluct.” Use “was/were reluctant” or “resisted” instead.
summary.zh: “relucted”是少见/不规范的用法，通常应改用“was/were reluctant”或“resisted”。

definition.en: (Nonstandard/rare) past tense of “reluct” meaning “to resist” or “to be unwilling.” In modern English, people usually say “was/were reluctant” or “resisted” instead.
definition.zh: （不规范/少见）“reluct”的过去式，表示“抗拒/不情愿”。现代英语更常说“was/were reluctant（不情愿）”或“resisted（抵抗）”。

examples.en: Nonstandard: She reluctantly agreed, but she seldom “relucted” in writing.
examples.zh: 不规范：她不情愿地同意了，但在书面语中几乎不写“relucted”。

examples.en: Better: She was reluctant to agree at first.
examples.zh: 更自然：她一开始不太愿意同意。

examples.en: Better: He resisted the idea until he saw the results.
examples.zh: 更自然：他一直抗拒这个想法，直到看到结果。

extraExplanation: “reluct”作为动词在现代英语里非常罕见，很多读者会把“relucted”当成拼写或用词错误。表达“不情愿”最地道的是用形容词：be reluctant (to do sth)。
常见搭配：reluctant to + 动词（不愿做……）；reluctantly + 动词（不情愿地……）。

summary.en: “Relucting” is a rare form (from the uncommon verb “reluct”). In modern English, people usually say “reluctant” or “reluctantly.”
summary.zh: “relucting”很少用，来自不常见的动词“reluct”。现代英语通常用“reluctant（不情愿的）”或“reluctantly（勉强地）”。

definition.en: (rare) resisting or struggling against something; being unwilling (present participle of “reluct”).
definition.zh: （罕见）抵抗/反对某事；不情愿（动词 reluct 的现在分词）。

examples.en: The committee kept reluctantly changing the plan, almost as if it were reluctanting under pressure. (less natural)
examples.zh: 委员会在压力下勉强修改计划，几乎像是在“relucting”（不太自然的用法）。

examples.en: More natural: The committee was reluctant to change the plan.
examples.zh: 更自然：委员会不愿意改变计划。

definition.en: (rare) to resist; to struggle against; to be unwilling.
definition.zh: （罕见）抵抗；反对；不情愿。

examples.en: He seemed to reluct at the idea of leaving home. (rare)
examples.zh: 他似乎对离开家这件事很抗拒。（罕见用法）

examples.en: More common: He was reluctant to leave home.
examples.zh: 更常见：他不愿意离开家。

extraExplanation: “relucting”在现代英语里非常少见，很多时候是把常用形容词“reluctant（不情愿的）”误写成了动词形式。日常表达建议用：be reluctant to do…（不愿意做……）、do sth reluctantly（勉强地做某事）。
“reluct”作为动词多见于较旧的文学或非常正式的语境；现代写作里通常用“resist / hesitate / be unwilling”或“be reluctant”。

summary.en: Reluctivity is a rare word for unwillingness, and a technical term in physics meaning magnetic reluctivity (inverse of permeability).
summary.zh: Reluctivity 既可（罕用地）表示“不情愿”，也可作物理术语指“磁阻率”（磁导率的倒数）。

definition.en: (Rare) unwillingness or hesitation to do something; a feeling of not wanting to act.
definition.zh: （罕用）不情愿；犹豫去做某事的心理状态。

examples.en: She showed reluctivity about speaking in public.
examples.zh: 她对公开演讲表现出不情愿。

examples.en: His reluctivity to ask for help made the project harder.
examples.zh: 他不愿意求助，让项目更难推进。

definition.en: (Physics/engineering) magnetic reluctivity: a material property that measures how strongly a material resists the formation of magnetic flux; it is the inverse of magnetic permeability.
definition.zh: （物理/工程）磁阻率：衡量材料对磁通形成的阻碍程度的材料性质；它等于磁导率的倒数。

examples.en: Air has high reluctivity compared with iron.
examples.zh: 与铁相比，空气的磁阻率更高。

examples.en: Designers choose core materials with low reluctivity to reduce magnetic losses.
examples.zh: 工程师会选择低磁阻率的磁芯材料来降低磁损耗。

extraExplanation: “reluctivity”在日常英语里非常少见。表达“（做某事）不情愿/犹豫”时，更自然、常用的词是“reluctance”（名词）或“reluctant”（形容词）。
在电磁学语境中，“magnetic reluctivity”是较专业的术语，常与“permeability（磁导率）”一起出现：reluctivity = 1 / permeability（在同一体系下的对应量）。

summary.en: “Relucts” is a rare form of the verb “reluct,” meaning “to be unwilling/hesitate” or “to resist,” but modern English usually prefers “be reluctant,” “hesitate,” or “resist.”
summary.zh: “relucts”是罕见动词“reluct”的三单形式，意思是“不情愿/犹豫”或“抵抗”，但现代英语更常用“be reluctant”“hesitate”或“resist”。

definition.en: (Uncommon) to hesitate or be unwilling to do something; to resist doing it
definition.zh: （不常用）不情愿做某事；犹豫、抗拒去做

examples.en: He reluctantly agreed, but he still seemed to reluct at the last minute. (More natural: “seem reluctant.”)
examples.zh: 他虽然勉强同意了，但到最后一刻看起来仍在犹豫/不情愿。（更自然：用“seem reluctant”。）

examples.en: She would not reluct to speak up if something felt unfair. (More natural: “would not hesitate.”)
examples.zh: 如果觉得不公平，她不会犹豫去发声。（更自然：用“would not hesitate”。）

definition.en: (Uncommon) (of a force, system, or material) to resist; to oppose movement or change
definition.zh: （不常用）（指力量、系统或材料）抵抗；阻碍（运动或变化）

examples.en: Some materials reluct heat and slow down the transfer of energy. (More natural: “resist.”)
examples.zh: 有些材料能抵抗热量并减缓能量传递。（更自然：用“resist”。）

examples.en: The old rules reluct change, even when new ideas appear. (More natural: “resist change.”)
examples.zh: 旧规则会抗拒改变，即使新想法出现。（更自然：用“resist change”。）

extraExplanation: “relucts”通常是动词“reluct”的第三人称单数（he/she/it relucts），但在现代英语里“reluct”这个动词非常少见，读者更熟悉的是形容词“reluctant”（不情愿的）以及动词短语“be reluctant to do sth.”。
如果你想表达“犹豫/不想做”，更地道的选择是：hesitate（犹豫）、refuse（拒绝）、be unwilling to（不愿意）或be reluctant to（不情愿去做）。
如果你想表达“抵抗/阻挡”，更常用的是：resist（抵抗）、oppose（反对）、hold back（阻挡/抑制）。

summary.en: Relume means to light something again, or (in literary use) to rekindle hope or feelings.
summary.zh: relume 指“再次点亮/重新点燃”，也可在文学语境中表示“重新燃起希望或情感”。

definition.en: to light again; to relight (something that was dark or extinguished).
definition.zh: 再次点亮；重新点燃（已熄灭或变暗的东西）。

examples.en: She relumed the candle after the wind blew it out.
examples.zh: 风把蜡烛吹灭后，她又把它重新点燃。

examples.en: At dusk, lanterns were relumed along the street.
examples.zh: 黄昏时，街边的灯笼又被重新点亮。

definition.en: (figurative, literary) to bring back hope, feeling, or memory; to rekindle.
definition.zh: （比喻，文学用法）重新燃起希望/情感/记忆；使复燃。

examples.en: Her letter relumed his hope during a difficult winter.
examples.zh: 在艰难的冬天，她的来信让他的希望重新燃起。

examples.en: Old songs can relume memories of home.
examples.zh: 老歌常常能重新点亮对家乡的回忆。

extraExplanation: “relume”较为古雅（archaic），现代英语更常用“relight”“rekindle”。前缀“re-”表示“再一次”，词根“lume”与“light（光）/illuminate（照亮）”同源，常见于诗歌或较文学化的写作中，用来营造“光重新出现”的意象。

summary.en: Relumed means “lit again” or “made bright again,” usually in a poetic or literary style.
summary.zh: Relumed 意为“再次点亮/重新发光”，多带文学或诗意色彩。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of relume) to light again; to make bright again, often used in a literary or poetic style.
definition.zh: （relume 的过去式/过去分词）再次点亮；使重新发光（多用于文学或诗歌语体）。

examples.en: The lanterns were relumed as night fell.
examples.zh: 夜幕降临时，灯笼又被重新点亮。

examples.en: Hope, once relumed, guided her through the hard days.
examples.zh: 希望一旦重新燃起，就指引她度过艰难的日子。

extraExplanation: “relume”较少见，常出现在较有文学感的写作中，用来强调“熄灭后再次发光/再度点燃”的意象。
词源可理解为 re-（再次）+ lume（光；源自拉丁语 lumen“光”）。因此 relumed 常用于火焰、灯光、星光，也常被引申为“希望/精神重新被点燃”。

summary.en: Relumes means “lights or shines again,” mainly in poetic or old-fashioned English.
summary.zh: relumes 表示“再次点亮/再次发光”，主要见于诗歌或较古雅的英语。

definition.en: to light (something) again; to shine again (often used in poetic or old-fashioned writing).
definition.zh: （使某物）再次点燃；再次发光（多用于诗歌或较古雅的用法）。

examples.en: At dusk, the lantern was relumed to guide the travelers home.
examples.zh: 黄昏时，灯笼被再次点亮，为旅人指路回家。

examples.en: Hope relumes in her voice after the long winter.
examples.zh: 漫长的冬天过后，希望又在她的声音里重新亮起。

examples.en: The stars relumed as the clouds drifted away.
examples.zh: 云散开后，星星又重新闪耀起来。

extraExplanation: “relume”由前缀 re-（再、重新）+ lume（光、火光）构成；lume 来自拉丁语 lumen（光）。
这个词在现代日常英语中很少用，更常见于文学/诗歌，给人一种“光重新被唤醒”的画面感。日常表达更常用 light again / relight / shine again。

summary.en: Relumine means “to light (up) again” or “to shine again,” often in poetic or literary writing.
summary.zh: relumine 指“再次照亮/重新发光”，常见于诗歌或文学表达。

definition.en: to light again; to make something bright again (literally or figuratively).
definition.zh: 再照亮；使再次发光/明亮（可指字面或比喻）。

examples.en: At dusk, the streetlamps relumine the quiet road.
examples.zh: 黄昏时分，路灯再次照亮安静的道路。

examples.en: Her kind words seemed to relumine his hope.
examples.zh: 她温柔的话语仿佛让他的希望重新燃起。

definition.en: to become bright again; to shine again.
definition.zh: 再次变亮；重新发光。

examples.en: After the clouds moved, the stars relumined.
examples.zh: 乌云散开后，星星又重新闪耀起来。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常少见，多见于诗歌或较文学化的语境。更常用的替代说法是 illuminate again / light up again / brighten again。
词源上可理解为 re-（再次）+ lumine（与“lumen 光”同源），意思就是“让光回来/再次发光”。

summary.en: Relumined means “lit up again” (past form of relumine).
summary.zh: Relumined 表示“再次被照亮/重新发光”（relumine 的过去式或过去分词）。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of relumine) to light up or illuminate again; to make bright again.
definition.zh: （relumine 的过去式/过去分词）再次照亮；使重新发光、变亮。

examples.en: The lanterns were relumined at dusk so the path stayed visible.
examples.zh: 黄昏时灯笼又被重新点亮，这样小路仍然清晰可见。

examples.en: After the power returned, the whole street was relumined in seconds.
examples.zh: 电力恢复后，整条街几秒钟内又重新亮了起来。

examples.en: In the poem, the moon relumined the lake like a mirror.
examples.zh: 在诗中，月光再次照亮湖面，像一面镜子。

extraExplanation: “relumine”由前缀 re-（“再次”）+ lum-（与 light/illuminate 同源，表示“光”）构成，因此 relumined 常用于较文学或较正式的语境，强调“重新点亮/恢复光亮”的画面感。
它比较少见；日常英语里更常用 lit up again / illuminated again / brightened again。

summary.en: “Relumines” means “lights up again” or “shines again,” and is a rare/poetic verb form.
summary.zh: “relumines”表示“再次照亮/再度发光”，多为罕见或偏文学的用法。

definition.en: (Rare, poetic) to light up again; to illuminate anew.
definition.zh: （罕见/文学用语）再次照亮；重新使……发光。

examples.en: At dusk, the streetlights relumined the empty road.
examples.zh: 黄昏时，路灯再次照亮了空荡的道路。

examples.en: The artist used bright color to relumine the scene’s hope.
examples.zh: 艺术家用明亮的色彩重新点亮了画面中的希望。

definition.en: (Rare) to shine again; to become bright after being dim.
definition.zh: （罕见）再次发亮；在变暗后重新变得明亮。

examples.en: After the storm passed, the sky relumined with stars.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，天空又被星光照亮。

extraExplanation: “relumines”常见于较少使用的动词“relumine”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it relumines）。在现代英语中更常见的表达是“re-illuminate / light up again / shine again”。
词形来源可理解为 re-（再、重新）+ lumine（与拉丁语 lumen “光”有关）。因此它带有一点诗意或文学色彩。

summary.en: Reluming means lighting something again or making it bright again, often in a literary way.
summary.zh: reluming 指“再次点亮/重新发光”，多带文学色彩。

definition.en: (literary) to light up again; to make bright again.
definition.zh: （文学/较少用）再次点亮；使重新发光、变亮。

examples.en: At dusk, she began reluming the lanterns along the path.
examples.zh: 黄昏时，她开始把小路旁的灯笼重新点亮。

examples.en: Hope, once lost, came reluming in his heart.
examples.zh: 曾经失去的希望，又在他心中重新燃起。

definition.en: the present participle/gerund form of “relume” (used to describe an ongoing action).
definition.zh: “relume”的现在分词/动名词形式（表示动作正在进行或作为名词使用）。

examples.en: Reluming the candles took only a minute.
examples.zh: 重新点燃蜡烛只花了一分钟。

extraExplanation: “relume”由 re-（再次）+ lume（光、火；与 illuminate 同源）构成，整体带有较强的文学色彩；日常英语更常用 light again / relight / brighten again。
在诗歌或较抒情的散文里，relume 常用来比喻“希望、记忆、情感重新燃起/复苏”。

summary.en: Relumine (and its form relumining) means “to illuminate again,” and can also mean “to make something feel clear or hopeful again.”
summary.zh: Relumine（以及其形式 relumining）意为“再次照亮；重新点亮”，也可比喻“让事物重新变得清晰或重燃希望”。

definition.en: to light up again; to illuminate anew
definition.zh: 再次照亮；重新点亮

examples.en: The sunrise relumined the room after the stormy night.
examples.zh: 暴风雨的夜晚过后，日出再次照亮了房间。

examples.en: They relumined the stage for the final scene.
examples.zh: 他们为最后一幕重新把舞台灯光点亮。

definition.en: (figurative) to make something clear, vivid, or hopeful again
definition.zh: （比喻）让某事再次变得清晰、生动或充满希望

examples.en: Her letter relumined his confidence in the future.
examples.zh: 她的信让他对未来的信心重新燃起。

examples.en: The new evidence relumined the case for the jury.
examples.zh: 新证据让陪审团对案件的理解重新变得清晰。

extraExplanation: “relumining”本身不太常见，通常更标准的词形是动词“relumine”的现在分词/动名词“relumining”（表示“正在重新照亮/再次照亮”）。在现代英语里它比较文学化、偏罕见；日常更常用“light up again / re-illuminate / illuminate again”。
词根上可理解为 re-（再次）+ lumine（光、照亮；同源于拉丁语 lumen “光”）。因此常见于较有文采的描写（如“光线重新回到某处”）。

summary.en: Rely means to depend on or to trust someone/something, most often used with “rely on/upon.”
summary.zh: Rely 表示“依靠/依赖”或“信赖/指望”，最常用结构是 rely on/upon。

definition.en: to depend on someone or something for help, support, or success
definition.zh: 依靠；依赖（某人/某事）来获得帮助、支持或成功

examples.en: I rely on my sister for advice when I’m stressed.
examples.zh: 我压力大时会依靠姐姐给我建议。

examples.en: Small businesses often rely on regular customers.
examples.zh: 小企业往往依靠回头客。

examples.en: You can’t rely on luck alone to pass the exam.
examples.zh: 你不能只靠运气就想通过考试。

definition.en: to trust that someone will do what they promised or that something will happen as expected
definition.zh: 信赖；指望（某人会守信/某事会如预期发生）

examples.en: You can rely on her to keep your secret.
examples.zh: 你可以信赖她会替你保守秘密。

examples.en: We rely on the train arriving on time.
examples.zh: 我们指望火车准时到达。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配是 rely on/upon + 名词/代词/动名词：rely on friends（依靠朋友）、rely on getting enough sleep（依靠充足睡眠）。
语气上，rely on 比 depend on 更强调“信任、把希望寄托在……上”；但在很多日常场景里两者可以互换。
固定句型：You can rely on me.（你可以信赖我/有事尽管靠我。）也可说：You can rely on it.（这事靠谱/一定会发生——较口语、语境依赖）。

summary.en: “Relying” means depending on or trusting someone or something, usually used with “on/upon.”
summary.zh: “relying”表示依赖或信赖某人/某物，通常与 on/upon 连用。

definition.en: depending on someone or something for support, help, or something you need
definition.zh: 依赖；倚靠（某人或某物来获得支持、帮助或所需之物）

examples.en: She is relying on her friends for emotional support.
examples.zh: 她正依靠朋友来获得情感支持。

examples.en: Many people are relying on public transportation to get to work.
examples.zh: 很多人依靠公共交通去上班。

definition.en: trusting that someone or something will do what you expect (often used with “on/upon”)
definition.zh: 信赖；指望（某人或某物会按预期做事，常与 on/upon 连用）

examples.en: We’re relying on you to finish the report by Friday.
examples.zh: 我们指望你在周五前完成报告。

examples.en: You can’t rely on the weather in spring.
examples.zh: 春天的天气不能指望太稳定。

extraExplanation: “relying”是动词 rely 的现在分词/动名词形式，最常见搭配是 rely on/upon + 人/事物。
语气对比：rely on 更中性，强调“需要/依靠”；count on 更口语，强调“指望、靠得住”；depend on 既可指“取决于”，也可指“依赖”。
固定表达：rely on yourself（靠自己）；rely on it（相信这事靠谱/可行）；don’t rely on it（别太指望）。
